publication_title: Characterization of adherent bacteroidales from intestinal biopsies of children and young adults with inflammatory bowel disease
comments: Biopsies were taken with standard forceps from the terminal ileum, cecum to descending, and recto-sigmoid colon from grossly inflamed (when present) and non-inflamed sites. Separate analyses of newly diagnosed IBD subjects were performed to avoid the potential effects that non-antibiotic medications may have on species distribution

publication_title: Altered enteric microbiota ecology in interleukin 10-deficient mice during development and progression of intestinal inflammation
comments: To determine the numbers and abundances of different bacterial groups in each sample we used 97% similarity between 16S rRNA gene sequences as an indicator of a ?species level? operational taxonomic unit (OTU). The dominant bacterial groups  are altered after colonization of mice with a specific pathogen-free (SPF) microbiota (week1, week 4).

Shifts in gut microbiota composition in an APP/PSS1 transgenic mouse model of Alzheimer's disease during lifespan
comments: The QIIME pipeline was used for identifying representative sequences for each operational taxonomic unit (OTU) generated from complete linkage clustering with a 97% similarity.Only female animals were included in order to prevent gender specific differences related to the appearance of amyloid deposition during ageing. Fecal samples were colleced from transgenic APP /PS 1 (TG ) mice, a well established deterministic mouse model of AD , with their C57BL /6 wild type (WT ) littermates.

publication_title: Molecular Profiling of Mucosal Tissue Associated Microbiota in Patients Manifesting Acute Exacerbations and Remission Stage of Ulcerative Colitis
publication_journal: World Journal of Microbiology and Biotechnology

publication_title: Inflammation-related Differences in Mucosa-Associated Microbiota and Intestinal Barrier Function in Colonic Crohn's Disease
publication_journal: American Journal of Physiology-Gastrointestinal and Liver Physiology
comments: patients with CD were categorized endoscopically and identified as either CD with no injury (CD-NI) or CD with injury (CD-I)-For CD-I patients, biopsies were taken from an area of colonic injury defined by the presence of hyperemia, friability, erosions, or ulceration, and an additional set of matched biopsies were taken from an adjacent area of endoscopically normal mucosa, within 5 cm of the inflamed area. In CD-NI patients, matched sets of biopsies from each group were taken from adjacent areas of colonic mucosa, within 5 cm of each other, that were endoscopically normal

publication_title: Protective effect of mulberry (Morus atropurpurea) fruit against diphenoxylate-induced constipation in mice through the modulation of gut microbiota
comments: Three groups administered different doses of mulberry powder that was dissolved well and distributed uniformly in the saline solution, namely, the high-dose group, the mid-dose group and the low-dose group. The control and treatment groups were administered the compound diphenoxylate31 by gavage for 5 days to induce constipation.Operational taxonomic unit (OTU) included dereplication, cluster, and detection of chimeras, with 97% sequence similarity.

publication_title: Gut Microbiota in Parkinson's Disease: Temporal Stability and Relations to Disease Progression
comments: All comparisons were performed on OTU, genus, and family levels, with data trimmed to include taxa that had more than one read in at least 1/10 of samples.Controls more commonly had a history of transient ischemic attack  or ischemic stroke and were on several medications more often than patients. group of PD stable patients are compared with progressed at follow-up timepoint 2 years later.
